items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The next high tide at Richmond at 05:30 on 24/02/2023 may result in brief low-level flooding of riverside roads and open spaces.

Astronomical tide levels are falling. The river flow at Teddington Weir is low for this time of year at 36 cubic metres per second and is steady. We anticipate the flows to remain low for the nextÂ five days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 10:00 on 24/02/2023, or as the situation changes, as subsequent tides over the next couple of days may be higher.

items.description: The Essex coast at Coalhouse Fort
items.message: Water levels are now below the flood risk thresholds. The forecast is for no current flood risk from high tides. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor levels closely.

items.message: Stormy conditions have now past, and the risk of tidal flooding along the South Humber Bank has now reduced and has fallen below levels of concern. No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.
